definition: to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Then, true to their word, they showed up – just as police were coming to greet them.
sentences.chinese: 說到做到，信守諾言，他們露面時，警察恭候在銀行。

sentences.english: I ran for President promising transparency, and I meant what I said.
sentences.chinese: 我在競選總統時承諾要做到透明化，我說到做到。

sentences.english: I'm not one to mess with.
sentences.chinese: 我說到做到，你們不要惹我。

sentences.english: When it’s all said and done, your success will depend on how well you played the game.
sentences.chinese: 說到做到，你的成功就在於你怎麼玩好這個遊戲。

sentences.english: This time we definitely mean it.
sentences.chinese: 這次，我們絕對說到做到。

definition: the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to have boundless prospects
to evade responsibility/to shirk
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
selfless/impartial
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
conciliation/mediation/to mollify/to propitiate/to reconcile
